website_summaries.verdict: Although these come at a higher cost, the quality is unbeatable, making this 2-pack the best battery option to get the most out of Makita tools.
pros: 2-pack of powerful batteries that add a wealth of run time to tools when used
Provides unmatched quality for optimal and powerful power tool use

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 4 year old Makita Grinder
customer_reviews.text: These do NOT work with my 4 year old grinder that was part of a $450 package of Makita 18V tools. All the others work. Another poster here says you can modify the tool to use the battery; But I can't afford to kill my batteries with my grinder. I don't make money from using these. I can say I am really mad at Makita for not having a BIG warning that these batteries DO NOT FIT ALL MAKITA 18V LXT TOOLS.
customer_reviews.author: Theta

customer_reviews.title: Best Makita LXT battery, worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: The 5.0Ah batteries are excellent. Much longer run time than 3.0Ah batteries in tools that drain power, such as the 36 volt (2-18 volt batteries) leaf blower and string trimmer. Rapid recharge. Although a bit more expensive, I'll buy only the 5.0Ah in the future (unless Makita comes up with an even better battery.) Love the Makita LXT system. I have the brushless drill & driver, miter saw, string trimmer, leaf blower, small blower and small vacuum. If Makita made an LXT mower I could be done with gas and oil, and cords for tools.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great battery for newer Makita tools
customer_reviews.text: Myself, my adult kids, and a number of employees use Makita battery tools. I have a number of the 3ah batteries that have lasted for many years. The newer 5ah batteries are more powerful. I have a blower that runs faster on the 5ah batteries. My only complain is some of the older tools won't accept the 5ah batteries. If your tool doesn't have the yellow plastic at the battery connection, you can use the 5ah battery.
customer_reviews.author: D Silver

customer_reviews.title: Makita BL1850B 18V LXT Lithium-Ion 5.0Ah Battery
customer_reviews.text: I received this Makita BL1850B 18V LXT Lithium-Ion 5.0Ah extra battery as part the Makita XT269T 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Brushless Cordless 2-Pc. Combo Kit. It was an additional battery inclued with my combo kit. Makita has upgraded their batteries since my last purchase five years ago. The batteries are more powerful, durable and longer lasting. The batteries also have and battery charge indicator showing the charge level. The only complaint I have is the cost. Thankfully I received it as a extra battery promotion.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lavoie

customer_reviews.title: Good longevity and power. More reliable than older Makita batteries.
customer_reviews.text: These 5AH batteries are the best choice for my battery-operates Makita tools. They put out a good level of current with minimal fading, recharge quickly, and with the additional circuitry in these newer batteries, they seem to last much longer; I haven’t lost a battery to the past “bad battery” failure to charge situation in a very long time. Even when they aren’t used for awhile, I haven’t noticed any excessive self discharge or battery life reductions.
customer_reviews.author: Plumb

customer_reviews.title: More power now with these 5.0amh than tools ever had when new. Saws work better & longer than ever before. All comes down ta bat
customer_reviews.text: Only took about a minute per tool ta cut little nub off battery slide groove, 1/8" x 1/8" battery stop. Couple strokes with Leatherman & all my old tools are better than new again. Finally use sawzall & circ saw now with these digital 5.0 beasts. Always wait way to long ta just toss weak batteries.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I use these batteries in a brushless saw and drill. They go and go and go. Incidentally, they weigh exactly the same amount as a 3 amp-hour battery. Go ahead and shell out for the 5 ah and you won't be sorry. Be aware that they do take longer to charge than a smaller battery.
customer_reviews.author: J. Beachy

customer_reviews.title: Lack of battery life
customer_reviews.text: Have been using Makita products for 15 years and this is the only time had bad experience. Returned first set of these batteries assuming they were lemons. Second set of batteries doing the same............limited battery life yet pay extra $ to get the 5.0 ah. My 7 year old 3.0 ah batteries have longer battery life. DO NOT BUY these if battery life important. Next time will spend 50% less and buy the knock off brand batteries.
customer_reviews.author: David Q

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory item
customer_reviews.text: I have an arsenal of Makita LXT cordless tools, as well as many chargers. I keep adding additional 5.00 Ah batteries for convenience when using my cordless blower for the driveway and back deck, It always requires that I have an extra battery to complete the job. You cannot beat Makita quality and utility in cordless tools.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Schock

customer_reviews.title: Strong!
customer_reviews.text: replacement for 3.0Ah battery. very good deal. You need attention for the old blushed cordless tool, dont put over work with this battery, it gonna burn the tool. But still work good for all 10 of my 18v tools!
customer_reviews.author: Hirorinskywalker

customer_reviews.title: Mind the tab...
customer_reviews.text: These batteries are replacing my original Makita 1830 18V LTX batteries that came with my tools. They fit the original charger and most of the tools (screwdriver, impact driver), but not the cutting tools (sawzall, circular saw). For reasons I havent bothered Googling, the Makita saws have a little square tab on the left side of the battery compartment, maybe for overheating or some other safety issue. Anyway, these batteries don't slide in (grooves on the battery are different). Simple fix, grind off the plastic tab with a Dremmel sander, or be OCD like me and use a small hand file. Works perfectly fine and i havent overheated my saws, yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy knock offs
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my knock off ones that didnt last more than 18 months. While I may have saved money at the time, I am glad I have these now. The button to the check the charge is real nice. I anticipate these should last 3-5 years based on my usage.
customer_reviews.author: Pdog

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: I originally thought the battery I received was a fake due to slight irregularities in its construction. However, after sending pictures to Makita they seem to think that it looks like a genuine battery with a different hardware revision.
customer_reviews.author: True

customer_reviews.title: This is not an authentic Makita battery.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fake Makita 18v. The plastic packaging said made in Japan but the battery said made in Korea and processed in Vietnam. If you compare to an authentic one you will see quite a fee differences. 1. The weight is different (lighter) they are clearly and visibly missing metal components. 2. The product is printed on with white lettering as opposed to imprinted and molded into the plastic. 3. The white plastic release button is shaped different. 4. Lastly the LED battery life indicator is not the same and lights up incorrectly compared with a Japanese made version.
customer_reviews.author: James Perfilio

customer_reviews.title: Game changer item. So many overlook the battery they use.
customer_reviews.text: I use my Makita tools everyday. Have purchased them as I need them over the years and wanted to have battery back ups. These are the only size I use they last a long time and if your working them hard you can have another one charged by the time you need to switch them out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Makita. Top quality.
customer_reviews.text: Quality made, fast charging, easy to use, and you get a LOT done on a single charge. I found the 5Ah to be and excellent balance of operating time between charges, and price. Feels to me you are not charging your battery too often, without the unnecessary splurge.
customer_reviews.author: Naama

customer_reviews.title: Great batteries. Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind paying the higher price for a battery that actually works and has thermal protection. A lot of the "unbranded" batteries do not have the quality control that the branded ones have. Work smart... Work safe.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Great batteries that allow for longer runtime for my drill and recip saw. Only complaint with these (and it is my same complaint for all Makita batteries) is that the battery level button is kind of hard to hit sometimes and doesn't always actuate. Otherwise fantastic deal compared to how much they are in the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin & Allison Palet

customer_reviews.title: Good battery
customer_reviews.text: Good battery with extended run time. I am using a reciprocating saw to cut up stumps, and need all the run time I can get. So far, this battery is great. I just wish it were not SO expensive, I’d buy two.
customer_reviews.author: SWS

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!!!
customer_reviews.text: They appear to be the real thing At a decent price! This is the second time I purchased these batteries They work great But it’s too soon to tell how long they are going to last..,
customer_reviews.author: skippy

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: These do NOT fit most Mikita tools. Are they knock-offs from China?
customer_reviews.author: Patti Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice batteries for brushless tools
customer_reviews.text: These are made for Makita Brushless tools. They won't fit the older tools with motor brushes. Supposedly you can modify your tools to make them fit. Another solution is to buy newer brushless tool versions.
customer_reviews.author: M Fiedler

customer_reviews.title: Makita is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I had an older set of these batteries, and one lasted 7 or 8 years. I am very pleased except for the price being a little high, they work fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great batteries
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic Makita batteries. Very long run times as you would expect from 5amps. The built in charge indicator is very useful. I wish they weren’t so stinking expensive, but they perform great.
customer_reviews.author: D354

customer_reviews.title: really hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: Using them on a Makita circular saw and the impact tool. Great performance , still on the first battery after many sheets of plywood, 2 x 4's and 2 x 6s cut. Well above expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Wildlife

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one.  No name ones don't last
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many replacement Makita batteries over the years and I have found the no name ones rarely last. So I buy the real ones and I am happy with that decision
customer_reviews.author: Blackford

customer_reviews.title: I have some 1. 5 AH and 3 AH ...
customer_reviews.text: I have some 1.5 AH and 3 AH batteries. Bought these for deck build. Holy smokes, 5 AH makes all the difference. You get way more top end torque for a lot longer using a 5 AH over either of the others. The meter on the back is handy. Buy them, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: A satisfied man

customer_reviews.title: Great way to add power and life to Makita tools
customer_reviews.text: These are new, genuine makita batteries. Charged them up and put them to work. Good compliment to my 2, 3, and 4 Ah batteries for longer jobs. Cheaper than buying them one at a time at the hardware stores.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Bremkamp

customer_reviews.title: Love it but wish it was cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Best for the power consuming tools like the weed cutter and circular saw - huge difference in run time vs 3 amp hr. By the way, for a battery with this much energy I would not trust the imitations. Opinions to the contrary would be welcome because these ARE expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Timbuckyball

customer_reviews.title: Good Batteries-Good buy for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these batteries several times since they have arrive and they are so much better than the 3 amp hr batteries. More power and longer run time!
customer_reviews.author: rodenwb

customer_reviews.title: Great battery
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3.0Ah version of this that has lasted 7 years so far, and holds a charge a really long time. Only downside is this is quite heavy.
customer_reviews.author: JD Larrick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome as usual
customer_reviews.text: Awesome batteries they work on older tools (my oldest set is only 6 years old) and newer tools (obviously). They really last a long time and the indicator is a very welcome upgrade from my old 3.0's. I won't knock the 3.0's either, I've done a lot of work with them as well. Makita in general is a very reliable company when it comes to cordless tools.
customer_reviews.author: blake

customer_reviews.title: seem to be great.
customer_reviews.text: I have used one of these batteries on an impact driver and many uses with the stick vacuum and the oscillating tool. It has yet to move from 4 to 3 lights. Cannot speak to longevity.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Higher amps longer life
customer_reviews.text: These batteries last a lot longer than the three amp. The charge time is about twice as long, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Makita batt
customer_reviews.text: these hold a better charge than the 3.0 I have been using
customer_reviews.author: bill g. md

customer_reviews.title: As represented and on time
customer_reviews.text: The battery was represented to be brand new, but without packaging. It was promptly shipped and received. It appeared to be new and I charged it and used it without problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my lawnmower and another pair for my weed trimmer. Works amazingly. No more gas or oil to worry about
customer_reviews.author: ElementaLizard

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting charge,
customer_reviews.text: This battery can be run down, but it's very hard. The charge lasts for longer than I care to work at one time.... The rapid chargers fire the dead battery back up in less time than one person can run the other one down.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Speed and power solves many things
customer_reviews.text: They’re batteries, they charge and last a long time. What else do you need to know? I use them daily and 1 last a week
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: Makita Battery charger
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It charged our flashlight and we are happy with the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Long

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Nice batteries. I really like the new feature where you can tell how much charge is left by pushing a test button. Have been performing flawlessly in a commercial application for months now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: Quality drops off
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened with Makita? Seems like these batteries won't hold a charge for very long anymore brand new and they died within an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great battery. Absolutely hate the price of Makita batteries, but, they have us hostage with great products. Right?
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Keep all electronics, fan-cell-speakers-tablet running in hot warehouse office !
customer_reviews.author: Motown

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Factory original like these are the way to go. Last long. Holds charge long while dormant
customer_reviews.author: Erik tungseth

customer_reviews.title: All Makita product is Power orginal
customer_reviews.text: One of the two batteries is valid and the other invalid 50% ✅ 50%❌
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Quality worth paying the price for. Don't make the mistake like I did and buy the much cheaper aftermarket battery's like I did. They didn't fit at all had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Pileits

customer_reviews.title: Love Makita!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth buying! These were up to the task of building a 480 sq ft Trex deck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a carpenter's assistant and relies on his batteries. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa J. Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: Power To Go
customer_reviews.text: There'll probably be lightweight 6.0AH or maybe even 7.0Ah available in a couple of years, but 2 pairs of the 5.0Ah plus a dual-port charger will keep me able to make serious noise without having to jump rope.
customer_reviews.author: jaymac

customer_reviews.title: Definitely more powerful than 2 ah
customer_reviews.text: Batteries were brand new in brand new packaging. Been using them on the job site for a little over a month haven't had any problems yet
customer_reviews.author: Richard McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I stepped up from 2.0 AH batteries- Highly recommended. Last a good deal longer, without much added weight.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Top DOGG
customer_reviews.text: very pricy but truly worth it for makita users. Best run time, untill they come out with 6ah
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Last a long time and seem more powerful
customer_reviews.text: Same size as all the 3Ah batteries and feels like the same weight but last a long time and seem more powerful. You can use them in your non star tool is you cut off a little nub on the tool handle.
customer_reviews.author: Gary MV

customer_reviews.title: Good but does not get fully Charge on 45 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Its a very good product but It does not get fully charged in 45 minutes, probably over 1 hours and 10 minutes it could be.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!! My techs go through batteries like crazy, so always good to have an extra charged!
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Amazing difference from 3
customer_reviews.text: Amazing difference from 3.0Ah! Lasted all day long on a single charge! Takes little longer to charge but worth the wait. Fits older tools too.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed. You can never have enough batteries.

customer_reviews.title: Makita what’s left to say.
customer_reviews.text: Makita is the best brand tools and batteries you can buy, I not one for giving perfect reviews , but. It’s worth it.

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE GOODS!!
customer_reviews.text: This seller is distributing defective products. I’ve used makita for over ten years, the batteries they’re selling don’t last long, and cause tools to stall at times.

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold charge as long as I expected. Will not fit on Makita rec. saw older model.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very strong battery and lasts a very long time for me in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: A must have tool for work in data centers & clean rooms. No more vacuum needed when drilling for anchors. Bought the bare tool & bought a pair of 5ah batteries for $20 more then the kit w/ 3ah batts. This tool is amazing! Seriously, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Filthy Frenchie

customer_reviews.title: Quality Batteries
customer_reviews.text: The batteries did not come damaged and were half way charged as expected. Makita is top quality you really can't go wrong.

customer_reviews.title: Makita lit batteries,
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of Makita tools and they make a great product, John

customer_reviews.title: great battery,
customer_reviews.text: great battery,, like the longer run time.. at about $100 a battery, if you rely on your cordless equipment for a living, there worth the purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Makita BL1850 Battery
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power. Use your nut driver or screw driver all day with out recharging. Just keeps on going. I purchased the Makita brand because I did not want to buy something I might have met my expectations. I do not regret spending the extra money on these.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent batteries for cordless!
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is excellant, except for use in my Makita leaf blower. Only good for 13 minutes on setting 6 ( high ), then have to recharge. You will need 4 batteries for 26 minutes.

customer_reviews.title: Great batteries with great performance!
customer_reviews.text: These batteries have great run time. Also almost the same weight as the 3.0 Ah batteries. They turn the XPH07 drill into a beast!

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice batteries, hope they last longer than my last set before failing completely.
customer_reviews.author: Scott b

customer_reviews.title: Excellent supplement to an aging battery fleet..
customer_reviews.text: Excellent batteries. I've used and abused the 3.0 batteries for a little more than 2 years now (daily) with very little capacity or life diminished from them. Added a couple 4.0 batteries about a year ago to supplement the two 3.0's, before the 5.0's came out (that I know of..) These are an excellent supplement to an aging battery fleet. Keep the old/small/weak ones for flash lights or zip guns, use the big ones for recip saws, angle grinders, impacts, and the like. The variety will do you well.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: they work in drills and flashlight won't slide into saw saw
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Lammers

customer_reviews.title: Makita FTW, BFF, OMG.
customer_reviews.text: Please, do NOT buy a knock off brand. Yes, they're expensive, but for a reason. THEY WORK, and they LAST.
customer_reviews.author: D. Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Won’t fit older Makita 18v tools
customer_reviews.text: It works great on my newer tools - not my older 18v drill, driver, saw or charger.
customer_reviews.author: David P Owsley

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I like the battery level indicator. Comes in very handy if you have a lot of makita batteries like I do. A big improvement over the 3.0

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: They work great and powerful nice for the use on my skill saw and grinder last way longer on the tools that draw more power

customer_reviews.title: Nice improvement
customer_reviews.text: I have the 1st gen and 2nd gen 5.0 batteries (ones with and without the battery life indicator.) great batteries and they last a very long time.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Use these batteries for several tools
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. Use these batteries for several tools. They last a long time on a single charge and have an indicator light to show when a charge is needed. They fit into all of my makita cordless power tools (all bought within the last 3 years)

customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical, they don't weight much more then the 3Ah ones but definitly lasted a lot longer. I didn't load test in any definitive way though.

customer_reviews.text: worth the extra money to buy the real brand instead of the knockoffs

customer_reviews.text: Great product but make sure you buy them on sale. These batteries typically run over $100 each.

customer_reviews.text: Those batteries are last long and great quality Thank you so much

customer_reviews.text: These are great batteries, they last so much longer than my old 3.0ah batteries. Love them.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Battery
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life! I use them for the Makita 1/2 inch impact and they last days before recharging (constant daily use).

customer_reviews.title: Never buy cheap batteries
customer_reviews.text: Tryed other brands never again will only buy original brand

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. Can't wait to change out the rest of my batteries with these. Now that I own a few of these batteries with the battery indicator lights, I won't buy anything but!

customer_reviews.text: Awesome power! It's like having a plug-in tool. So glad I bought these as I get more work done on carpentry jobs with less down-time wasted charging my old batteries!!

customer_reviews.title: Both batteries defective out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I got both of these batteries and they were both defective will not charge. Requested a return of the items waiting on the seller.

customer_reviews.title: first thing, I am a Makita fanatic, these ...
customer_reviews.text: first thing, I am a Makita fanatic, these 5 amp batts last all day and more depending on what tool i am using, highly recommend

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is top of the line battery pack with 5Amp hr. But it is pricy

customer_reviews.title: 5 Amp hour batteries are a winner!
customer_reviews.text: To me run time is king, and the 5 amp hour batteries coupled with Makita's brushless motor tools, are the crowning achievement! Add in the new charge level lights on board the batteries themselves, and Makita has a winner. Now we never have to wonder where we are with how much longer we have before changing out batteries; we can always keep track of it right on the batteries themselves. Thanks, Makita!

customer_reviews.text: doesn't fit any of my Makita cordless tools, no information was included in the ad as to the cordless tools these batteries fit

customer_reviews.text: Work great. new life and more RPMs in old tools. Be careful some of the later models wont accept this battery.

customer_reviews.title: Power and versatility
customer_reviews.text: I use these in all my makita tools. They provide great runtime and power.

product_meta.title: Makita BL1850B-2 18V LXT Lithium-Ion 5.0Ah Battery Twin Pack
product_meta.description: Style:2-PackThe Makita 18V LXT Lithium-Ion battery charges faster and works longer than standard lithium-ion batteries, giving you and your cordless tools unmatched performance and productivity to take on the most demanding applications. The Makita 4.0 Ah battery combines more run time (35% more run time per charge than the Makita BL1830 battery) with a category-leading charge time of only 40 minutes, so it spends more time working and less time sitting on the charger. For added convenience, it also features an L.E.D. charge level indicator to monitor battery charge. The 18V LXT 5.0Ah battery (BL1850) is compatible only with star protection tools, indicated by the Star Symbol and/or Yellow Battery Receiver under the tool. Makita 18V Lithium-Ion batteries resist self-discharge so they're ready for use even after long periods of storage. The Makita Rapid Optimum Charger (sold separately) is a smart-charging system that communicates with the battery during the charging process to monitor current, voltage and temperature. This advanced charging technology helps optimize battery life and deliver a faster charge. In addition, the Charger has a built-in fan to cool the battery for faster and more efficient charging, even in hot weather conditions. For improved tool performance and extended battery life, Makita created STAR Protection Computer Controls. STAR Protection is communication technology that allows the tool and battery to exchange data in real time and monitor conditions during use to protect against overloading, over-discharging and overheating. Makita, the innovation leader in cordless tool technology, has the world's cordless tool line-up powered by an 18V lithium-ion slide-style battery.
feature_bullets: Integrated L.E.D. battery charge level indicator allows user to monitor battery charge
Provides up to 65 percentage more run time per charge compared to BL1830
Reaches full charge in 45 minutes or less
Battery delivers consistent power and run time in extreme temperatures, even in winter ( 4 degree F/ 20 degree C)
